intro: Cucurbita pepo var. taenapion, commonly known as the acorn squash, is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated, and often ribbed fruit. The plant produces large, edible fruits with a tough, dry outer skin and a sweet, nutty flavor inside. It is typically cultivated for its seeds and flesh, which are used in various culinary applications. The plant prefers well-drained soil and full sun, and it is relatively drought-tolerant once established. It is an annual vine that can grow up to several meters in length, with large, heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers.
